thread.title: Jamie Carragher believes contract rebel Emre Can may not be at Liverpool next season
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher believes contract rebel Emre Can may not be at Liverpool next season

author: Alex Smith
title: Jamie Carragher believes contract rebel Emre Can may not be at Liverpool next season
text:
Sport Jamie Carragher believes contract rebel Emre Can may not be at Liverpool next season The German midfielder is out of contract at the end of next season and is stalling on contract talks Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe 
Jamie Carragher believes Emre Can's days at Liverpool could be numbered. 
German midfielder Can blasted in his his fourth goal of the season to edge the Reds past Burnley on Sunday. 
But the former Bayer Leverkusen man is out of contract at the end of next season and is stalling on a new deal. 
Kop legend Carragher thinks he could be sold in the summer if he fails to come to an agreement. 
He said: "Can's big problem is that I don't think he's a versatile player but he's played in four or five positions for Liverpool. Can scores against Burnley (Photo: REUTERS) Can is out of contract at the end of next season (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Emre Can's Liverpool career in numbers Share this video Watch Next 
"The only position I think he can play is the one he played [against Burnley], the sitting midfielder, because he needs legs around him. [Klopp] is playing Jordan Henderson ahead of him. 
"Now, he's got a contract situation at the moment, Emre Can. Is he going to sign it? Is he not? I think he may have 12 months at the end of the season. 
"So there is a good chance he may not be here next season. I don't see, when the first XI is picked, where else he can play except that role. 
"That role is for the captain Jordan Henderson, who I can see how much he is missed in the last three or four games he's been out." poll loading Will Emre Can leave Liverpool this summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
